nodes.bodyText: Can we rename the class something like, 'HadoopNestedDirsGenerator' OR 'HadoopMultiDirsGenerator' to make it clear about the responsibility of the class.

nodes.bodyText:
can you please add java comment or javadoc describing the nested dir structure that this function creates. For example,
/rootdir
   |
   |+ level1dir1
   |+ level1dir2
          |
          |+ level2dir1
          |+ level2dir2
I have added the required comments.
NIT: tool to test OM performance
Changed
Replace command name with something less cryptic, example dirgen, gendir as we have similar commands like genconf etc.
Freon commands have cryptic names (ockg, dfsv, etc.), but they also have more readable aliases.  This one also does: dfs-directory-generator.
As far as I know Freon commands have cryptic names therefore I have given "ddsg", also I have given readable name "dfs-directory-generator".
Add short name option -p for path

nodes.bodyText: Default value assumes the bucket name and volume name. What happens if this volume or bucket does not exist?

nodes.bodyText:
If volume or bucket does not exist then command will not execute successfully and it will show number of successful executions=0.
Also default value just assumes a bucket and volume, you can pass your own bucket and volume(which already exists) with "-r" or "--rpath" parameter.
